document_data.name: Most Careful Order of Skilled Smiths & Metalforgers
document_data.orgname: the Most Careful Order of Skilled Smiths & Metalforgers
document_data.mainbody: The '''Most Careful Order of Skilled Smiths & Metalforgers''' was a [[guild]] of blacksmiths and metalworkers operating out of the city of [[Waterdeep]].
document_data.Organization: The Master of the guild was both the leader of the Order, and the primary point of contact for those wanting to make contact with the group as a whole, or wishing to join. The guild imported, and provided its members with the raw materials needed for their crafts. They also made the tools that their members required for their work, either renting or selling them, while ensuring they remained well-maintained.
document_data.Activities: Guildmembers were always busy, crafting everyday metal objects, such as brackets, chains, hinges, horseshoes, latches, needles, and the like. They were also responsible for crafting simple weapons such as hammers and maces.
document_data.Tactics: In business, the guild prided themselves in being able to design efficient, yet elegant items; produce their crafts quickly; and, when required, replicate those designs with exacting precision.
document_data.Base of Operations: The guildhouse, named [[Metalmasters' Hall]], was a large, three-story building in [[Waterdeep/Southern Ward|Southern Ward]] on the eastern side of the [[High Road]], near the magical signpost known as the Waymoot.
document_data.Members:
Members tended to be people who were very strong and hardy, with impressive tolerances for the heat and din of the forge. They had to pay thirty [[Currency#Waterdeep|dragons]] to join the guild, and paid a further twenty in annual dues.

Members wore a uniform consisting of red tunics with a black hammer (head at the top of a vertical handle) on the breast, and gray caps with black plumes.
